schemas.name: patient
schemas.description: The collection of data elements with demographic information about a patient.

fields.name: patient_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the patient, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: age
fields.description: Age of the patient at the time of initial encounter.

fields.name: administrative_gender
fields.description: Administrative Gender - the gender that the patient is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.
fields.notes: Codes should align with FHIR Administrative Gender value set (http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/administrative-gender)

fields.name: race
fields.description: Concepts classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality. The race codes used to represent these concepts are based upon the CDC Race and Ethnicity Code Set Version 1.0.

codeList: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

fields.notes: Codes from http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/ValueSet/omb-race-category

fields.name: ethnicity
fields.description: Concepts classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality. The ethnicity codes used to represent these concepts are based upon the CDC Race and Ethnicity Code Set Version 1.0.
fields.notes: Codes from http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/ValueSet/omb-ethnicity-category

fields.name: zip_code
fields.description: Five digit zip code.

schemas.name: patient_vital_status
schemas.description: An indicator of whether the patient is alive or dead.

fields.name: vital_status
fields.description: Donor's last known state of living or deceased.

fields.name: recorded_date
fields.description: The date the vital status was observed.

fields.name: cause_of_death
fields.description: Indicates the cause of a patient's death.
fields.notes: Cause of death is only required to be submitted if the patient is deceased. Mortality coding of COVID-19 with ICD-10 see: https://www.who.int/classifications/icd/COVID-19-coding-icd10.pdf?ua=1

schemas.name: patient_identification
schemas.description: Personally identifiable information about a patient.

fields.name: family_name
fields.description: The part of a name that links to the genealogy.

fields.name: given_name(s)
fields.description: Given names (not always 'first'). Includes middle names.

fields.name: address_line
fields.description: This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information.

fields.name: address_city
fields.description: The name of the city, town, suburb, village or other community or delivery center.

fields.name: address_state
fields.description: US 2 letter state code.

fields.name: primary_phone_number
fields.description: Preferred phone number for the patient.

schemas.name: condition
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a condition. A condition can be either a diagnosis or part of an ongoing problem list.

fields.name: condition_id
fields.description: Unique identifier assigned to the condition.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The code to represent the diagnosis or problem.
fields.notes: This field accepts either ICD-10-CM or SNOMED-CT disorder codes.

fields.name: category
fields.description: Condition category which distinguishes between a diagnosis or a problem.
fields.notes: Include all codes defined in http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/condition-category.

fields.name: recorded_date
fields.description: The date that the condition was recorded.
fields.notes: This is different from the condition onset date which could be a period of time prior to the date recorded by the provider.

fields.name: onset_date
fields.description: An estimate or actual date that the patient reported experiencing the condition.

fields.name: verification_date
fields.description: Date when condition was confirmed by positive test, imaging, biopsy, or other method.

fields.name: clinical_status
fields.description: The clinical status of the condition. (Reference source: FHIR Condition clinical status from http://hl7.org/fhir/condition-definitions.html#Condition.clinicalStatus).
fields.notes: The clinical status value set terms are described at http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-condition-clinical.html.

schemas.name: allergy_intolerance
schemas.description: The collection of data elements describing the details of a patient's allergies and intolerances.

fields.name: allergy_intolerance_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the allergy or intolerance.

fields.name: code
fields.description: A code for the agent causing the allergy or intolerance.
fields.notes: RxNorm or NDF-RT for medication allergies/intolerances; SNOMED CT for non-medication allergies/intolerances.

fields.name: recorded_date
fields.description: The date that the allergy or intolerance was recorded.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Distinguishes whether the item refers to an allergy or an intolerance

fields.name: category
fields.description: The type of allergy or intolerance.

schemas.name: medication_administration
schemas.description: An instance of administering a medication to a patient.

fields.name: medadmin_id
fields.description: Unique identifier assigned to the medication administration episode.

fields.name: medadmin_status
fields.description: The status of the medication administration
fields.notes: The medication administration status value set terms are described at https://www.hl7.org/fhir/valueset-medication-admin-status.html.

fields.name: medication_code
fields.description: The code to represent the medication that was administered.
fields.notes: medication_code is a structure which contains codeSystem, code, and name. For RxNorm, all prescribable medication formulations represented using either a 'generic' or 'brand-specific' concept. This includes RxNorm codes whose Term Type is SCD (semantic clinical drug), SBD (semantic brand drug), GPCK (generic pack), BPCK (brand pack), SCDG (semantic clinical drug group), SBDG (semantic brand drug group), SCDF (semantic clinical drug form), or SBDF (semantic brand drug form). Source: http://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3/ValueSet-us-core-medication-codes.html.

fields.name: medadmin_dose_quantity
fields.description: The amount of the medication given at one administration event.

fields.name: medadmin_dose_units
fields.description: Unit of measure for the dose quantity of the administered medication.
fields.notes: Nomenclature conforms to the Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM): https://unitsofmeasure.org/trac

fields.name: medication_route
fields.description: The path of the substance into the body for the administered medication.

codeList: Include codes from http://snomed.info/sct  where concept is-a 284009009 (Route of administration values)

fields.name: medadmin_start_date
fields.description: The date and time when the medication administration was started.

fields.name: medadmin_stop_date
fields.description: The date and time when the medication as administered to the patient.

fields.name: medorder_id
fields.description: Unique identifier assigned to the medication order episode.

fields.name: medorder_status
fields.description: The status of the medication order
fields.notes: The medication order status value set terms are described at http://hl7.org/fhir/CodeSystem/medicationrequest-status.

fields.name: medication_code
fields.description: The code to represent the medication that was administered.
fields.notes: medication_code is a structure which contains codeSystem, code, and name. For RxNorm, all prescribable medication formulations represented using either a 'generic' or 'brand-specific' concept. This includes RxNorm codes whose Term Type is SCD (semantic clinical drug), SBD (semantic brand drug), GPCK (generic pack), BPCK (brand pack), SCDG (semantic clinical drug group), SBDG (semantic brand drug group), SCDF (semantic clinical drug form), or SBDF (semantic brand drug form). Source: http://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3/ValueSet-us-core-medication-codes.html.

fields.name: medorder_dose_quantity
fields.description: The amount of the medication given per medication administration event.

fields.name: medorder_dose_units
fields.description: Unit of measure for the dose quantity of the ordered medication.
fields.notes: Nomenclature conforms to the Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM): https://unitsofmeasure.org/trac

fields.name: medication_route
fields.description: The path of the substance into the body for the ordered medication.

codeList: Include codes from http://snomed.info/sct  where concept is-a 284009009 (Route of administration values)

fields.name: medorder_frequency
fields.description: The timing for the frequency that the medication should be taken.
fields.notes: frequency was made a string instead of a complex data structure to simplify the collection of data.

fields.name: medorder_start_date
fields.description: The date and time when the medication order was or will be started.

fields.name: medorder_stop_date
fields.description: The date and time when the medication order will be discontinued. This is specified when a given medication is ordered for a limited period of time.

fields.name: medorder_reason_code
fields.description: The condition associated with the reason for the medication order.
fields.notes: This field accepts either ICD-10-CM or SNOMED-CT disorder codes

schemas.name: procedure
schemas.description: An action that was performed on or for a patient. This can be a physical intervention like an operation, intubation, or less invasive services.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The code representing the procedure. A procedure is an action performed on a patient, including diagnostic tests, therapies - such as respiratory therapy, surgeries, and other clinical interventions.
fields.notes: SNOMED CT (preferred), ICD-10-CM (preferred) or HCPCS (alternative).

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the procedure in terms of workflow.

fields.name: start_date
fields.description: The date and time the procedure started.

fields.name: end_date
fields.description: The date and time the procedure ended.

schemas.name: smoking_status
schemas.description: Data elements associated with the patient's use of smoking tobacco.

fields.name: smoking_status
fields.description: The status of the patient's use of smoking tobacco.
fields.notes: SNOMED CT code as defined in FHIR US Core Smoking Status: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/ValueSet/us-core-observation-smokingstatus.

fields.name: recorded_date
fields.description: The date when the smoking status was recorded.

schemas.name: laboratory_result
schemas.description: A result of a laboratory test.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The code representing the type of laboratory test.
fields.notes: Use lab code from http://loinc.org if available.

fields.name: effective_date
fields.description: Clinically relevant date for the laboratory test, e.g., when the sample was obtained.

fields.name: performer_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the patient, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: result_code
fields.description: Coded result of the lab.
fields.notes: Result is either a code or a quantity.

fields.name: result_quantity
fields.description: Quantitative result of the lab.

fields.name: result_quantity_units
fields.description: The units associated with a quantitative result.
fields.note: Units must be reported for quantitative results

fields.name: interpretation
fields.description: The interpretation of the result, for example, high.

schemas.name: lab_result
schemas.description: An individual laboratory test and result value

fields.name: lab_result_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the lab test.

fields.name: lab_result_code
fields.description: The code associated with the lab test.
fields.notes: LOINC is preferred as the coding system for the lab test. In cases where there is a no LOINC code immediately available, a local test code would be accepted provided that there is a code system listing where the code originated.

fields.name: clinical_status
fields.description: The clinical status of the condition. (Reference source: FHIR Condition clinical status from http://hl7.org/fhir/condition-definitions.html#Condition.clinicalStatus).
fields.notes: The clinical status value set terms are described at http://hl7.org/fhir/observation-status.

fields.name: recorded_date
fields.description: The date when the lab result was recorded.

fields.name: lab_result_value_string
fields.description: The value associated with a lab result, represented as a string.
fields.notes: A lab result can have many variations of data_types. The implementer should only select one type of lab_result_value associated with each lab result.

fields.name: lab_result_value_numeric
fields.description: The value associated with a lab result, represented as a number. The number can be either an integer or a float.
fields.notes: A lab result can have many variations of data_types. The implementer should only select one type of lab_result_value associated with each lab result.

fields.name: lab_result_units
fields.description: Unit of measure for the associated with the lab result value.
fields.notes: Nomenclature conforms to the Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM): https://unitsofmeasure.org/trac

fields.name: lab_result_interpretation
fields.description: An interpretation associated with the lab test result

codeList: Any of the codes specified in the http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ObservationInterpretation value set.

schemas.name: encounter
schemas.description: Data elements associated with an encounter at a health care facility, such as an ambulatory visit, an emergency department visit, or a hospitalization.

fields.name: encounter_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for the encounter.

fields.name: encounter_class
fields.description: A classification of the encounter, e.g. ambulatory, emergency or inpatient
fields.notes: Permissible values descriptions are available at http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/ActEncounterCode/vs.html.

fields.name: admission_date
fields.description: The date the patient was admitted for the encounter

fields.name: admission_source
fields.description: The type of location the patient originated from.

codeList: Any of the codes specified in the http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/admit-source value set

fields.notes: Definitions for the permissible values are available at http://hl7.org/fhir/codesystem-encounter-admit-source.html.

fields.name: discharge_date
fields.description: The date the patient was discharged from the encounter

fields.name: discharge_disposition
fields.description: Categorization of the status of the patient at discharge according to the type of location the patient was discharged to.
fields.notes: Definitions for the permissible values are available at https://www.hl7.org/fhir/valueset-encounter-discharge-disposition.html

fields.name: initial_diagnosis
fields.description: The initial working diagnosis (also known as 'chief complaint') first entered into the EHR

fields.name: admitting_diagnosis
fields.description: The main diagnosis code used to admit the patient.
fields.notes: An admitting diagnosis is only expected to be available for inpatient encounters.

fields.name: discharge_diagnosis
fields.description: The final diagnosis determined to be the main cause for the hospitalization after all testing, surgery, and workup are complete.
fields.notes: Discharge diagnosis is only expected to be available for inpatient encounters that have been completed.

schemas.name: encounter_location
schemas.description: Data elements associated with specific locations the patient during the course of an inpatient encounter.

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for the encounter location.

fields.name: encounter_id
fields.description: The identifier for the encounter associated with this particular location

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of location according to its function/purpose

codeList: Any of the codes specified in the http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-ServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType value set.

fields.notes: Definitions for the permissible values for location type are available at http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/ServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType/vs.html

fields.name: arrival_datetime
fields.description: The date and time the patient arrived at the location.

fields.name: departure_datetime
fields.description: The type of location according to its function/purpose

fields.name: length of stay
fields.description: The length of time a patient spent in the location.
fields.notes: Can be derived: departure_datetime - arrival_datetime

schemas.name: vital_signs
schemas.description: Data elements associated with the physiologic measurements of a patient that indicate the status of the body's life sustaining functions, also known as vital signs. (Source: United States Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI). https://www.healthit.gov/isa/united-states-core-data-interoperability-uscdi)

fields.name: code
fields.description: A code for the vital sign of interest, e.g. heart rate.

codeList: 59408-5  Oxygen saturation in Arterial blood by Pulse oximetry

fields.name: value
fields.description: The result of measuring the vital sign.

fields.name: unit
fields.description: The unit for the measured vital sign value.
fields.notes: Units associated with each of the permissible vital sign codes are listed in http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/observation-vitalsigns.html

fields.name: measurement_date
fields.description: The date and time the measurement of the vital sign occurred.

schemas.name: medication_list
schemas.description: Data elements associated with medications on the patient's medication list. The medication list is maintained as part of a medication reconciliation process and asserted by the patient or the patient’s caregiver​.

fields.name: code
fields.description: A code for the medication the statement is about.
fields.notes: medication_code is a structure which contains codeSystem, code, and name. For RxNorm, all prescribable medication formulations represented using either a 'generic' or 'brand-specific' concept. This includes RxNorm codes whose Term Type is SCD (semantic clinical drug), SBD (semantic brand drug), GPCK (generic pack), BPCK (brand pack), SCDG (semantic clinical drug group), SBDG (semantic brand drug group), SCDF (semantic clinical drug form), or SBDF (semantic brand drug form). Source: http://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3/ValueSet-us-core-medication-codes.html.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the medication.
fields.notes:
The permissible values' terms are consistent with and described in http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-medication-statement-status.html.
TODO: Stopped, on-hold, unknown, and not-taken are not specified in the argonaut DQ IG, and the value set's binding strength is required. Seems reasonable to include these terms based on the way med lists are managed (and the terms are included in the latest US Core release.

fields.name: recorded_date
fields.description: The date when the statement about the medication statement was made.

fields.name: start_date
fields.description: The date the partient started taking the medication.

fields.name: end_date
fields.description: The date the patient stopped taking the medication.
fields.notes: Stop date time is only required for medications the patient is no longer taking.

schemas.name: signs_symptoms
schemas.description:
Data elements related to the signs and symptoms patients typically exhibit for COVID-19. 
 Data sources: these data elements may be captured as part of a disease-specific EHR screening/exposure tool, or as part of a public health surveillance case report form.

schemas.name: symptom_status
schemas.description: Data elements related to the determination of whether the patient is symptomatic or assymptomatic presentation of COVID-19.

fields.name: symptom_status
fields.description: A determination made on whether the patient exhibited signs or symptoms of COVID-19.
fields.notes: Can be derived from signs_symptom_assessment data elements. Expression: signs_symptoms_assessment.code in signs_symptoms.code.permissible values AND signs_symptoms_assessment.symptom_presence is 'present'.

fields.name: recorded_date
fields.description: The date the patient's symptom status was evaluated.

fields.name: symptom_onset
fields.description: The date the patient's symptoms first started.

fields.name: symptom_abatement
fields.description: The date the date the symptoms resolved.
fields.notes: Symptom abatement date will not be present if the patient is symptomatic at the time symptom status is assessed.

schemas.name: signs_symptoms_assessment
schemas.description:
Data elements related to the signs and symptoms patients typically exhibit for COVID-19. 
 Data sources: these data elements may be captured as part of a disease-specific EHR screening/exposure tool, or as part of a public health surveillance case report form.

fields.name: symptom_code
fields.description: A determination on whether the patient has experienced a specific symptom.

fields.name: symptom_presence
fields.description: Whether a sign or symptom was present or absent

fields.name: assessment_date
fields.description: The date the patient's symptoms were assessed.
